examples: Marilyn: I'm vivacious, I'm a risk taker, I'm an adventurous person.
Described by her loved ones as silly, vivacious, and resilient, Bernita was a loving partner to her soul mate, Edwin, and a devoted mother and grandmother.
words.defineEn: vigorous and animated
words.defineVi: mạnh mẽ và hoạt hình

words.defineEn: characterized by high spirits and animation
words.defineVi: đặc trưng bởi tinh thần cao và hoạt hình

words.defineEn: give new life or energy to
words.defineVi: cung cấp cho cuộc sống mới hoặc năng lượng để

examples: The 2nd century Greek physician Galen gleaned what he could about the human form by performing vivisections on pigs.
words.defineEn: the act of operating on living animals (especially in scientific research)
words.defineVi: hành động phẫu thuật trên động vật sống (đặc biệt là trong nghiên cứu khoa học)

examples: Whales are incredible marine animals that migrate long distances.
These things can migrate thousands and thousands of miles.
The centrosomes migrate to the opposite ends of the cell.
Animals migrate for good reasons.
Those purple outer layer cells migrate out.
words.defineEn: to move from a country or region in search of a better job or living conditions

examples: Many migratory birds fly south for the winter and return north in the spring.
Now a number of animals, like migratory birds, frogs, and mollusks, use the Earth’s magnetic field to orient themselves or navigate.
There are some problems with this theory, though: For one, not all of positively phototactic insects are migratory, and not all of those use the moon to navigate.
A recent survey finds that wind turbines are killing not only local birds, but some that are migratory.
Many animals, especially migratory birds, are believed to use the sense for long-distance navigation, using it to find the right direction to travel.
words.defineEn: habitually moving from place to place especially in search of seasonal work
words.defineVi: thường xuyên di chuyển từ nơi này sang nơi khác, đặc biệt là để tìm kiếm công việc thời vụ

examples: We'll be up a creek if the car dies on that desolate road ahead.
It would be a very desolate place to live.
As Shiva despaired over the desolate Earth, He came to realize that the material world could not be so easily dismissed.

And when the news came home, when I lost my dad, in some ways, I became every desolate family that I have reported on outside of hospital doors that are too overrun to make space for patients or cremation grounds that have run out of spaces.

And when the news came home, when I lost my dad, in some ways, I became every desolate family that I have reported on outside of hospital doors that are too overrun to make space for patients or cremation grounds that have run out of spaces.
words.defineEn: providing no shelter or sustenance
words.defineVi: không cung cấp nơi trú ẩn hoặc thức ăn

examples: The thought drove him to despair.
Despair seems to have set in among the team.
Despair closed in on her.
Her husband's violent and abusive behavior drove her to the verge of despair.
Despite the challenging circumstances, she refused to yield to despair and fought for a better future.
words.defineEn: abandon hope; give up hope; lose heart
words.defineVi: từ bỏ hy vọng; Từ bỏ hi vọng; mất lòng

words.defineVi: một kẻ ngoài vòng pháp luật táo bạo (đặc biệt là ở biên giới nước Mỹ)

examples: Seeing no other option, the politician decided desperate times call for desperate measures and made a controversial speech spreading misleading information to sway the crucial election results.
Seeing no other option, the politician decided desperate times call for desperate measures and made a controversial speech spreading misleading information to sway the crucial election results.
In a desperate attempt to beat the clock, I raced to mail my tax return before midnight.
Megan regretted throwing herself at Terry, realizing later that her actions came across as desperate and needy.
It was clear to everyone at the club that Peter was throwing himself at anyone who showed the slightest interest, desperate for attention.
words.defineEn: (of an act) without much hope for its success and done when nothing else works
words.defineVi: (của một hành động) không có nhiều hy vọng về sự thành công của nó và được thực hiện khi không có gì khác hoạt động

examples: The second novel, Parable of the Talents, takes place five years after the end the previous novel.
That religious experience would come up often in her work, especially in the Parable series.

Released in 1993, Parable of the Sower takes place in the distant future of 2024, when society in the United States and our favorite unholy trinity of climate change, wealth inequality, and corporate greed has ravaged the nation leaving in in a state of pure dystopia.

Parable of the Talents (408) Even the utopian society she is constructing starts off with a little crumb of colonization, addressing that nothing can truly detach humanity from that sin, especially when tied to the United States.

While all of her novels and short stories have a lot we could discuss, we decided to focus on the Parable novels because there is nothing like living in your own dystopia to make things come into focus - if you get what I mean.
words.defineEn: a short fictitious story with a moral or spiritual lesson, especially one told by Jesus Christ in the Gospels
words.defineVi: một câu chuyện hư cấu ngắn với một bài học đạo đức hoặc tinh thần, đặc biệt là một kể bởi Chúa Giêsu Kitô trong Tin Mừng

examples: Our progress and degeneracy seems to be rapid.
